cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast across Florida tonight, then accelerating NE along the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts toward the offshore waters east of New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near the Suwannee River–Mexico Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from north of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC; hurricane warning Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Gulf side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through GA, SC, NC and northward into the Mid-Atlantic including coastal Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not certain (forecast 2‒4 inches, locally higher)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (guidance suggests 1‒3 ft along VA tidewater)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt gusts) possible Sunday as the center passes near or just east of Hampton Roads
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–3 ft above normal tides possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches with isolated 5 inches, producing localized flash-flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low risk of brief tornadoes in outer rain bands
